description: In this course, students analyze globalization and its consequences through two related lenses:
the ethical and the literary. First, students explore this phenomenon historically and
philosophically, and consider different ethical responses to globalization's consequences. Then,
students read and analyze works of Anglophone literature (English-language literature from Africa,
Asia, and the Caribbean) that engage these very issues. This approach both reorients
